trial_identification.studytitle: Older People, Omega-3, and Cognitive Health
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An 18 month study investigating the effects of long chain omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation on cognition and wellbeing in older people.
trial_identification.secondaryid: Commonwealth Scientific Industrial Research Organisation: le51

conditions.healthcondition: age-related cognitive decline in older adults

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of the normal brain and nervous system

interventions.interventions: 18 month intervention of either: ACTIVE: long chain omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids (430mg DHA; 150 mg EPA) Participants will consume 2 capsules in the morning and 2 in the evening for 18 months.
interventions.comparator: PLACEBO: Olive oil capsules Participants will consume 2 capsules in the morning and 2 in the evening for 18 months.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Participants will be assessed on a broad battery of cognitive tasks and measures of wellbeing, at 4 six-monthly intervals.
Participants will be assessed on a broad battery of cognitive tasks and measures of wellbeing, at 4 six-monthly intervals.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary outcomes are: plasma fatty acid changes blood pressure, oxidative stress and inflammation.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Markers of plasma fatty acid status, oxidative stress, systemic inflammation, and blood pressure will be assessed at each of the 4 six-monthly assessment points.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: fluency in the English language agree to not commence own n-3 fish-oil (or algal) supplementation throughout the duration of the study
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: already taking n-3 fish-oil (or algal) supplements inability to swallow capsules physically unable to attend laboratory/use pen and paper diagnosed with intellectual disability, clinical depression, dementia score < 24 on the dementia screeening measure at screening, have had head injury, stroke, coronary artery bypass surgery, any known degenerative neurological disease, history of alcohol or drug abuse

trial_design.concealment: allocation concealed when it was done by central randomisation by computer
trial_design.sequence: random allocation using computer software clinstat
trial_design.designfeatures: longitudinal, 4 repeat testings at 6-monthly intervals. Participants, test administrators, and data anlayst will be blinded until after the main outcome data is analysed for an effect.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study design: a parallel 18-month randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled intervention trial with repeated measures every 6 months, totalling 4 measurement points. Participants: 400 men & women, aged 65-90 years. Intervention: Half the participants will receive fish-oil capsules and the other half will receive placebo capsules for 18 months. Outcome measures: cognitive performance and cognitive change, well-being, blood pressure, oxidative stress, and inflammation. Demographic and nutritional data will be collected as covariates.
